questiontext.text:
Trigonometric identities Trigonometriske identiteter

An identity is a relation which is always true. To emphasise this the symbol ‘\(\equiv\)’ is often used rather than ‘\(=\)’. For example, \((x+1)^2\equiv x^2+2x+1\) (always true) but \((x+1)^2=0\) (only true for \(x=-1\)). En identitet er en relasjon som alltid er sann. For å understreke dette brukes ofte symbolet '\(\equiv\)' i stedet for '\(=\)'. For eksempel, \((x+1)^2\equiv x^2+2x+1\) (alltid sant) men \((x+1)^2=0\) (bare sant for \(x=- 1\)).
